major_battles_this_quarter: Battle of Wadi Akarit (5-6 April 1943): Surprise night assault by 4th Indian and 50th Divisions with 51st in support. 51st Division mounted assault on Djebel Roumana feature with two brigades. Heavy German counter-attacks from 15th Panzer Division repulsed. Fierce fighting all day 6 April. Division suffered heaviest casualties to date but held positions.
Tunisia Campaign finale (April-May 1943): Pursuit of retreating Axis forces. Axis surrender 13 May 1943.
Regrouping and refitting (May-June 1943): Rest, replacements, amphibious training for Operation Husky (Sicily invasion 10 July 1943)
notes: Wadi Akarit: 51st attacked Djebel Roumana with 152nd and 154th Brigades
German counter-attacks by 15th Panzer Division with tanks caused heavy casualties
Division held positions despite fierce fighting - described as 'fiercest to date'
4th Indian Division's silent night attack on Djebel Fatnassa succeeded brilliantly
50th Division attacked center between Fatnassa and Roumana
X Corps (1st Armoured, NZ Divisions) failed to exploit breakthrough quickly
Axis forces withdrew night 6-7 April, ending North Africa campaign resistance
13 May 1943: Axis forces in Tunisia surrendered (250,000 prisoners)
Division rested and refitted May-June for Sicily invasion
Amphibious assault training conducted for Operation Husky
Sicily invasion launched 10 July 1943 (outside Q2 timeframe)
